p: Envenoming by poisonous snake is a serious medical problem, especially in rural areas of tropical region. Thus, efficacious treatment should be available [ 32]. Screening of medicinal plants antidotes to ameliorate snake venom induced toxicity is very key in snakebite management [ 10] due to limitations of anti-venom. In this study, high mortality was observed in untreated envenomed rats as death was observed 2Â h post-envenomation indicating N. haje venom was highly toxic and fatal [ 33]. However, extract partitions of M. oleifera reduced mortality in envenomed treated groups suggesting the protective effects of the plant against N. haje venom toxicities.
